answers.answer: It's good your checking with your Dr., but no, I do not believe it is considered safe during pregnancy.  Many women use it at the end to help bring on labor, so it's usually considered a bad idea unless you are full term.  Now, this is the information I was given, I'd be very curious to hear what your Dr. says.  Could you please update us?

I will def tell you what my doc says, but i thought drinking it was completely safe and good for you near the end of pregnancy! Both my sisters drank it from 32 weeks, and they had fast labors (2-4 hours) thanks to that tea! It doesn't bring on labor, rather it helps your cervix soften and dilate quicker when you are in labor. I will update Wednesday and let u know what i get told.

It should be perfectly fine to drink, usually its reccomended to start from around 36 wks pregnant if your pregnancy is  "üneventful", it helps strenghten and tone your uterus, which helps with contractions by making your uterus work harder and this is what can help shortnen labour, you usually need to drink around 3-6 cups a day, or alternatively you can take the tablets :)

Well, it is certainly very possible I wasn't given accurate info.  I asked when I was in third trimester in a natural foods store, and she told me not until I was term.  This wasn't a Dr., just a clerk in a natural food store.  I never pursued it any further.  I do think it's always best to check in with your Dr. to be safe, and am glad your doing so.  I'm interested in his thoughts for sure as the topic comes up a fair amount.
